website_summaries.verdict: With a responsive touchscreen lining, these gloves are great for everyday wear and flexible enough for layering on chilly days.
pros: Quick-drying fleece and grippy, touchscreen-compatible palms
Medium weight fits comfortably under mitts in cold weather
Sizes XS to large with choice of color and pattern
cons: Not warm enough for very cold days or winter sports

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: These fit great I have normal to small hands and got the small. It does work with my iphone on the touch screen! I was impressed because I have other gloves that claim to be compatible that are not. Cute design and has little grips on the palms. These will be great fro skiing, I haven't used them outside yet so we will see how warm they really are.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Lady

customer_reviews.title: No stretch
customer_reviews.text: I finally did it I lost a glove at the mountain. This pair was to replace a similar pair. These are not made as well. They are very short in the wrist, not stretchy and very hard to get on. I am sure they will work to touch a screen to have on under my mittens but I am watching for the others to come back in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Boy#4

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves but not what I would call large
customer_reviews.text: I suspect they'll be excellent gloves but the women's large was way too small for me. I ended up with men's medium, which were a bit tight, but the men's large were too long. I gave these to a woman friend with shorter fingers than mine and she she was thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: S. Steinacher

customer_reviews.title: ... LOT of gloves for my upcoming trip and I'm glad I went with these
customer_reviews.text: I researched a LOT of gloves for my upcoming trip and I'm glad I went with these. The touchscreen really works and they kept my hands decently warn in sub 30 degree weather. Its not the warmest glove, but its perfect for walking around outside.
customer_reviews.author: C.C

customer_reviews.title: Received the wrong product, in the wrong size, in the wrong color.
customer_reviews.text: Received this today, specifically ordered it off amazon because I need them to go skiing tomorrow. And the item is a completely different product (“Powerstretch liner” when I ordered the “Touch n go liner”, is two sizes bigger than what I ordered, and is in the wrong color. Thanks amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: sloppy fit
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are not at all what I would expect from Burton. They have a very sloppy fit to them. I was hoping that I could use these under my mittens like the ones that come with the Gore Tex gloves. There is no way, they do not fit like the other liners. If they had a velcro wrist strap or something similar, maybe.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Crane

customer_reviews.title: Solid pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Thick enough to wear when I’m running errands on a cold day, but not too thick to fit comfortably under my mitts when I’m on the mountain. It’s fairly easy to send a text or answer a call while wearing these, and the material holds up well in the wash.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Masten

customer_reviews.title: Soft and warm enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my wife and she is in love with them because of soft materials, quality you expect from Burton and perfect Touch N Go function.
customer_reviews.author: Viacheslav Pishel

customer_reviews.title: Warm, comfortable and functional!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are some of the most comfortable and functional gloves I own. You don’t need to take them off to use your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves!
customer_reviews.text: They are pretty thick for a liner glove and warm enough that I can wear them solo on the mountain when it’s over 30 degrees F. Touchscreen feature works great.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Just get them.
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. Wife loves them and she is picky. Just get them. Nuff said.
customer_reviews.author: AyaZ

customer_reviews.title: Best glove
customer_reviews.text: I buy a new pair every year. They are my favorite driving glove/dog walking glove. I use the old pairs as gardening gloves in cooler weather.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Albrecht

customer_reviews.title: Burgundy not purple
customer_reviews.text: Color was not purple like shown. It was blah burgundy. I have very very small hands so I ordered the XS. They were so tight.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Touchscreen fabric works great on my iphone 7
customer_reviews.text: Touchscreen fabric works great on my iphone 7. Add a fingerprint to your Touch ID with the glove on and voila! Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Diana S

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and functional
customer_reviews.text: Pretty colors. Goes with several of my coats. Good grip on back.
customer_reviews.author: gran4

product_meta.title: Burton Women's Touch N Go Liner
product_meta.description:
The women's Burton Touch N Go Glove's slim profile makes it perfect for layering under Burton's all-season gloves and mitts on the coldest days, or wearing on its own while hiking or shoveling. A suede palm delivers serious grip while the DRYRIDE Thermex fleece fabric equals quick drying, breathable comfort. However the best kept secret about these simple liners is the touchscreen-compatible Screen Grab palm and fingers for texting, 'gramming, or that on-the-chairlift check of the snow report.
